txt1: The following text is about the employee onboarding process. It begins when you make an introduction.  After making an introduction, providing a job description with responsibilities needs to be done.  Once providing a job description with responsibilities occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: explaining your expectations, touring the office.  When touring the office is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: assigning training material, holding a welcoming ceremony.  Once assigning training material occurs, assigning a mentor needs to be done.  When holding a welcoming ceremony is completed, taking out to lunch needs to be done.  Then, you need to check the paperwork. When checking the paperwork is completed, planning check-in meetings should be done.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following is about the employee onboarding process. It begins when you make an introduction. After an introduction, a job description with responsibilities has to be made. When a job description with responsibilities comes to be, one or more of the following paths should be implemented: explaining your expectations, touring the office. When the office tour is completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed : assigning training materials, holding a welcoming ceremony. Once the training material is assigned, it must be assigned to a mentor. When the ceremony of a welcome must be completed, takeout to lunch is needed. Then you have to check the paperwork. When paperwork is completed the checking-in meetings should be completed. The process is now complete.

Once assigning required reading materials occurs, creating accounts should be done.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then explaining your expectations needs to be done.  After explaining your expectations, one or more of the following paths should be executed: getting approval, explaining expectations for the following month.  After that, one or more of the following paths should be executed: reviewing onboarding process over the next 60 days, planning check-in meetings.  Once planning check-in meetings occurs, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: encouraging them to socially interact with the team and providing reading material for personal growth.  After encouraging them to socially interact with the team, explaining long-term goals should be done.  The process is now completed.

txt1: The following description is about the employee onboarding process. It starts with making an introduction.  After making an introduction, providing a job description with responsibilities should be done.  After providing a job description with responsibilities, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: touring the office and assigning training material.  Once assigning training material occurs, the next tasks should be taking out to lunch and explaining your expectations, they should be done in parallel.  Once taking out to lunch occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: holding a welcoming ceremony, inducting into company culture, assigning a mentor.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: explaining expectations for the following month, assigning first project, checking the paperwork.  When assigning first project is completed, getting approval needs to be done.  Then, the process is split into 3 parallel branches: reviewing onboarding process over the next 60 days, explaining long-term goals and planning check-in meetings.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description is about the employee onboarding process, which starts with making an introduction. After the introduction, a job description should be filled with responsibilities. After providing a job description and responsibilities, the process is divided into 2 parallel branches: touring the office and assigning training material. Once the training material is assigned, the next tasks should be taking over lunch and explaining your expectations ; they should be done in parallel. Once the eating out occurs, one or more of the following paths should be followed : welcoming a ceremony, inducting a mentor into the company culture. Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: explaining expectations for the following month, assigning the first project, checking the paperwork. When the first project assignment is completed, it needs approval. Then, the process is split into 3 parallel branches : reviewing the onboarding process over the next 60 days, explaining long-term goals and planing check-in meetings. The process is now complete.

txt1: The following text is about the employee onboarding process. It starts with making an introduction.  Once making an introduction occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: discussing role, goals and projects with supervisor, giving access to any tools they will need, getting approval.  After getting approval, you need to prepare employee paperwork. After that, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: explaining your expectations and touring the office.  After explaining your expectations, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: inducting into company culture and assigning training material.  After assigning training material, holding a welcoming ceremony should be done.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: getting approval, explaining expectations for the following month.  After getting approval, checking the paperwork needs to be done.  After explaining expectations for the following month, you need to assign first project. Then, one or more of the following paths should be executed: encouraging them to socially interact with the team, reviewing onboarding process over the next 60 days.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the employee onboarding process. It starts with an introduction. After explaining your expectations, the process is divided into 2 parallel branches, induction into company culture and assigning training material. After getting approval, the paperwork needs to be checked. After explaining expectations for the following month, you are required to assign the first project. Then one or more of the following paths should be followed : encouraging them to socially interact with the team, reviewing the Onboarding process over the next 60 days. The process is now completed.

txt1: The following description is about the employee onboarding process. It starts with making an introduction.  Once making an introduction occurs, one or more of the following paths should be executed: assigning required reading materials, creating accounts.  After assigning required reading materials, the next tasks should be preparing benefits package and getting approval, they should be done in parallel.  When preparing benefits package is completed, preparing employee paperwork should be done.  Once getting approval occurs, the process is split into 3 parallel branches: giving access to any tools they will need, preparing employee's workstation and discussing role, goals and projects with supervisor.  Afterwards, the process is split into 2 parallel branches: taking out to lunch and assigning a mentor.  Once all pre-tasks are executed, then one or more of the following paths should be executed: explaining expectations for the following month, assigning first project, checking the paperwork.  Once checking the paperwork occurs, getting approval should be done.  After that, one or more of the following paths should be executed: reviewing onboarding process over the next 60 days, encouraging them to socially interact with the team, planning check-in meetings.  The process is now completed.
txt2: The following description is about the employee onboarding process, and starts with a brief introduction. Once an introduction is made, one or more of the following paths should be executed: authoring required reading materials, creating accounts. After appointing required reading materials, the next task should be preparing benefits package and getting approval ; they should be performed in parallel. When the preparation of the benefits package is completed, the employee paperwork should be prepared. Once approval occurs the process is divided into 3 parallel branches : giving access to all tools they need, preparing employee’s workstation and discussing role, goals and projects with supervisor. The process is then divided into 2 parallel branches: taking out to lunch and assigning a mentor. Once all pre-tasks are completed, one or more of the following paths should be executed: explaining expectations for the following month, assigning first project, checking paperwork. Once the paperwork checks are completed, approval should be done. After that, one or more of the following path should be executed: reviewing the onboarding process over the next 60 days, encouraging them to interact socially with the team, planning check-in meetings. The process is now complete.

txt1: The following text is about the employee onboarding process. It starts with making an introduction.  When making an introduction is completed, preparing benefits package should be done.  After preparing benefits package, one or more of the following paths should be executed: assigning training material, touring the office, holding a welcoming ceremony.  Afterwards, one or more of the following paths should be executed: assigning first project, checking the paperwork.  Afterwards, you need to review onboarding process over the next 60 days. The process is now completed.
txt2: The following text is about the employee onboarding process and starts with an introduction. When an introduction is completed, the benefit package should be prepared. After preparing the benefits package, one or more of the following paths should be executed: the assignation of training material, tours of the office, holding a welcome ceremony. After that, one or more of the following paths should be executed: assigning the first project and checking the paperwork. Afterwards, you will need to revisit the onboarding process in the next 60 days. The process is now completed.
